title: Vietnamese national drowns in seas off Moragalla
byline: A foreign woman who went for a swim at the Moragalla beach in Aluthgama has drowned and died, police noted.

title: Three arrested for aiding Borella shooting that killed two
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the shooting incident at Sahaspura in Borella, which claimed the lives of two persons and left 3 others injured.

title: Doctors call off strike after talks with Health Minister
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to call off their island-wide strike action which was slated to commence today (11).

title: Australia to recognise Palestinian state in September
byline: Australia will recognise a Palestinian state at the UN General Assembly in September, following similar moves by the UK, France and Canada, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has said.

title: Suspect arrested with Ambergris worth over Rs. 5 million
byline: A suspect has been arrested by Divulapitiya Police while in possession of a large stock of ‘Ambergris’, estimated to be worth over Rs. 5 million.

title: Five Al Jazeera journalists killed in Israeli strike in Gaza
byline: Five Al Jazeera journalists have been killed in an Israeli strike near Gaza City’s Al-Shifa Hospital, the broadcaster has said.

title: Apple likely to launch revamped Siri in 2026 with App intents feature
byline: Apple is gearing up to release a major Siri upgrade next year, aiming to transform its voice assistant into a more capable, hands-free controller for the iPhone.

title: One killed, dozens injured, as 6.1 earthquake hits western Turkey
byline: A 6.1-magnitude quake struck Sindirgi in western Turkey on Sunday, the Turkish disaster management agency (AFAD) said, killing at least one person and injuring dozens more.

title: Three including woman arrested with narcotics worth Rs. 2 million
byline: Three individuals, including a woman have been arrested in Karuvappankerny, Batticaloa with a stock of narcotics valued at around Rs. 2 million, police stated.

title: Several spells of light showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of light showers will occur in the Western, North-western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today.

title: Fatal ‘rat fever’ cases among children on the rise: Experts
byline: The potentially fatal leptospirosis (rat fever) disease is currently on the rise, according to Dr. Deepal Perera, a pediatric specialist at the Lady Ridgeway Children’s Hospital in Colombo.

title: Three injured after lorry crashes, catches fire on Southern Expressway
byline: A lorry traveling along the Southern Expressway from Kottawa has met with an accident near the Kurundugahahetekma area after crashing into a safety barrier.

title: ITAK calls for ‘hartal’ in North and East on Friday
byline: A ‘hartal’ will be observed on Friday (15), in the North and East to protest against the alleged “brutality of the military”, according to the Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi.

title: South Korea military shrinks by 20% due to low birthrate
byline: South Korea’s military has shrunk to about 450,000 people - a decline of 20% over the last six years, according to a defence ministry report released by a ruling party lawmaker on Sunday.

title: Bus collision with truck kills 11, injures 45 in Brazil
byline: A crash between a bus and a truck in Brazil’s center-western state of Mato Grosso killed 11 people and injured another 45 late Friday, the toll road operator and Brazil’s federal highway police said on Saturday.

title: Fire breaks at Galle Fisheries Harbour, four boats destroyed
byline: A fire has broken out on several fishing vessels docked at the Galle Fisheries Harbour.

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 1.4 million in 2025
byline: A total of 1,408,335 tourists have arrived in Sri Lanka so far this year, marking a significant increase compared to the same period in 2024, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority stated.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas of Gampaha tomorrow
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas of the Gampaha District tomorrow (11), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: PDEXCIL to strengthen trade ties between India and Sri Lanka
byline: The Powerloom Development Export Promotion Council (PDEXCIL) will strengthen trade linkages between Indian and Sri Lankan textile industries for a sustainable and long-term cooperation, said K. Sakthivel, its chairman, in a recent press release.

title: “No staff member would exert undue influence in actions taken by Police”: Public Security Ministry
byline: An individual who falsely claimed to be the secretary of Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala has been arrested by police for making calls to the Maharagama Police.

title: Heroin smuggler nabbed in Kalutara with heroin worth Rs. 1.5 million
byline: An associate of a member of an organized crime group who had been smuggling heroin to Kalutara and surrounding areas using the eZ Cash system has been arrested with heroin worth approximately Rs. 1.5 million, police stated.

title: “India won’t yield to threats, US not able to digest our growth”: Venkaiah Naidu
byline: India will not compromise on its strategic and national interests and will continue to safeguard its energy security despite external pressure, former Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu said on Saturday amid escalating US trade tensions.

title: A/L Exam to begin on November 10, O/L Exam in February 2026
byline: The 2025 GCE Advanced Level Examination will be held from November 10 to December 5, 2025, the Commissioner General of Examinations, AKS Indika Kumari Liyanage has announced.

title: Examinations Chief makes special appeal regarding scholarship exam
byline: Commissioner General of Examinations AKS Indika Kumari Liyanage has urged parents to refrain from questioning their children on how they answered the exam papers following the conclusion of today’s Grade Five Scholarship examination.

title: Weeragula Police Sub Inspector dies shooting himself
byline: A Sub Inspector attached to the Weeragula Police Station has reportedly died after shooting himself with his service firearm, the Office of the Police Media Spokesman stated.

title: Europe stresses need to protect Ukrainian interests ahead of Trump-Putin talks
byline: European leaders on Saturday welcomed U.S. President Donald Trump’s plans to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin on ending the war in Ukraine, while stressing the need to keep pressure on Moscow and protect Ukrainian and European security interests.

title: Four astronauts home from space station after splashdown
byline: An international crew of four astronauts is back home on Earth after nearly five months aboard the International Space Station, returning safely in a SpaceX capsule.

title: 704 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 704 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (09).

title: Mars rock found in Niger sells for millions in New York - now the country wants answers
byline: “Brazen! It is brazen!” Prof Paul Sereno says down the phone line from Chicago.

title: Ex-President Ranil to make a special statement today
byline: Former President and Leader of the United National Party Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to deliver a special statement today (10).

title: Maldives sees record 108 foreign investments in 1 year: Minister
byline: The Maldivian government has attracted 108 foreign investments in about one year, a marked improvement from previous years, state-run PSM News reported on Saturday, quoting a senior minister.

title: ‘Walas Kata’ injured during escape attempt, admitted to National Hospital
byline: Thilina Sampath, also known as ‘Walas Kata’, has sustained injuries to both legs and one arm while attempting to escape from the Western Province North Crime Division.

title: Seven Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in seas off Mannar
byline: A total of seven Indian fishermen have been arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters off Mannar, the Sri Lanka Navy stated.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship exam results to be released before September 20
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, AKS Indika Kumari Liyanage, says that the results of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination held today (10), is expected to be released before September 20.

title: Man arrested in Wellawatte with Rs. 3.5 million worth of e-cigarettes
byline: An individual has been arrested with a stock of e-cigarettes, valued at approximately Rs. 3.5 million, which are banned for use in the country, according to the Wellawatte Police.

title: “Sri Lanka’s youth clubs should not be politicised”: Ex- President Ranil
byline: Sri Lanka’s youth clubs should not be drawn into political agendas, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has stated.

title: Rumesh Tharanga sets new national record in Javelin Throw
byline: Sri Lanka’s Rumesh Tharanga has set a new national record during the first round of the Men’s Javelin Throw event at the World Athletics Continental Tour – Bronze in India, with a distance of 86.50m.

title: Governor General of Australia Samantha Mostyn concludes official visit to Sri Lanka
byline: The Governor General of Australia Samantha Joy Mostyn and her delegation who were on an official visit to Sri Lanka, departed the island, from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, this morning (10).

title: India estimates about 55% of goods exported to US will face Trump tariff
byline: About 55 per cent of India’s merchandise exports to the United States will be subject to the tariff imposed by President Donald Trump’s administration, the Indian government said on Monday.

title: Daya Lankapura named Chairman of the Right to Information Commission
byline: Daya Lankapura, a veteran journalist and media trainer, has been appointed as the Chairman of the Right to Information (RTI) Commission of Sri Lanka.

title: Wikipedia operator loses court challenge to UK Online Safety Act regulations
byline: The operator of Wikipedia on Monday lost a legal challenge to parts of Britain’s Online Safety Act, which sets tough new requirements for online platforms and has been criticised for potentially curtailing free speech.

title: GMOA and Health Ministry continue to clash over doctors’ transfer process
byline: The GMOA has accused the Ministry of Health of delaying the implementation of agreements reached with the Health Minister regarding the rectification of irregularities in the doctors’ transfer process.

title: Unemployed graduates stage protest opposite JVP Headquarters in Pelawatte
byline: A protest organized by the Combined Association of Unemployed Graduates was held today opposite the Ministry of Education in Pelawatte.

title: Elon Musk’s Tesla applies to supply power to UK homes
byline: Elon Musk’s electric car and energy company Tesla has applied for a licence to supply electricity to British homes.

title: Another 11 Sri Lankans trapped in cybercrime centres in Myanmar
byline: Information received that 11 Sri Lankans have ended up in cybercrime centres in Myanmar during the past several weeks -Defence Ministry.

title: Court grants permission to detain and question suspects in Sahaspura shooting incident
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today granted permission to the CCD to detain and question the three suspects arrested in connection with the shooting incident in Borella on August 7.

title: ‘Weapons’ beats ‘Freakier Friday’ in global box office faceoff
byline: Warner Bros – flying high at the summer’s global box office with DC Studios’ Superman and Apple’s F1 – has another hit on its hands with the release of Zach Cregger’s Weapons.

title: Petition challenging Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill filed at SC
byline: A petition has been filed before the Supreme Court challenging the bill presented to Parliament by the government seeking to revoke the privileges of former Presidents.

title: Chilaw resident held at BIA with Rs. 115 million worth of gold biscuits
byline: An individual has been arrested by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department at the Bandaranaike International Airport with a stock of gold biscuits valued at over Rs. 115 million.

title: President discusses pre-budget proposals for 2026 with officials
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has chaired a meeting at the Presidential Secretariat to review projects implemented under the 2025 budget allocations for the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation, and to discuss pre-budget proposals for 2026.

title: 975 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 975 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (10).

title: Another 11 Sri Lankans trafficked to Myanmar cybercrime centres
byline: Another 11 Sri Lankans have been trafficked to Myanmar to work at cybercrime centres, according to the Ministry of Defence.

title: Donald Trump says he will deploy US National Guard in Washington DC
byline: President Donald Trump said on Monday he was putting Washington’s police department under federal control and ordering the National Guard to deploy to the nation’s capital.

title: Puttalam court orders ilmenite processing site to be placed under police custody
byline: A court in Puttalam today (11) ordered that the ilmenite processing site located in Aruwakkalu adjacent to the Wilpattu National Park boundary, be placed under police custody until further investigations are completed.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas of Gampaha on Thursday
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas of the Gampaha District on Thursday (14), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Over 120,000 arrested on drug-related offenses so far this year
byline: More than 120,000 individuals have been arrested in connection with various drug-related offenses so far this year, according to a statement issued by the Ministry of Public Security.
